description: This module presents an economic perspective to issues arising from urban and regional development. It explains economic principles relevant to land market and urban policy analysis. Topics to be discussed include the rise and decline of city economies, the demand and supply for spaces in cities, the spatial structure of cities and its effect on the urban economy, the role of the market and the government in resource allocation in cities. Students are expected to apply the economic thinking to addressing contemporary urban challenges, such as climate mitigation, housing affordability, and job growth.
title: Urban Economics
